titleInfo.subTitle: Max Goodrich oral history interview, 1995

name.description: Max Goodrich (1905-1999) graduated from the University of Minnesota and came to LSU in 1937. He taught physics before becoming dean of the Graduate School in 1961. He played a key role in bringing to LSU in 1965 a large National Science Foundation Development Grant that changed the complexion of the mathematics and physical science departments. He retired in 1973.

mods.abstract: Goodrich discusses the LSU Physics Department, his research in electron scattering in gases and artificial radioactivity, his tenure as dean of the Graduate School, and his friendship with Chancellor Cecil Taylor.
